name: Fallout Terminal
description: # Fallout Terminal_v1.1 Updates:_* There are now useroptions to specify the colors for the terminal screens.With this script, you can set up a token to display an interactiveFallout-like terminal in the chat.## Creating a TerminalTo create a terminal, create a token whose name starts with 'terminal'and copy-paste the JSON defining your terminal's content into its gmnotes.## Activating a TerminalWhen this script is installed, it creates a 'displayTerminal' token macrofor all the GM players. Just select the terminal's token and click thetoken macro to activate the terminal.## Terminal JSON specificationThe JSON for defining a terminal's content has the following structure:```{  "name": String, // The name of the terminal.  "content": String, // The content of the terminal's first screen.  "locked": [Boolean], // Whether the terminal is locked. Default false.  "password": [String], // The password for the locked terminal.  "attempts": [Number], // The number of attempts allowed to guess the locked terminal's password.  "screens": [{ // The screens or screen IDs that the initial screen can access.    {      "name": String, // The name of this screen.      "content": [String], // The content of this screen.      "screens": [more screens] // Additional screens that can be accessed from this screen.    }  }]}```### Terminal JSON ExampleFor an example of JSON used to display a terminal, see the example here:https://raw.githubusercontent.com/Roll20/roll20-api-scripts/master/FalloutTerminal/example.json
